013package org.apache.juneau;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.ClassMeta.ClassCategory.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
019import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConsumerUtils.*;
020import static java.util.Arrays.*;
021
022import java.io.*;
023import java.lang.annotation.*;
024import java.lang.reflect.*;
025import java.lang.reflect.Proxy;
026import java.net.*;
027import java.net.URI;
028import java.time.temporal.*;
029import java.util.*;
030import java.util.Date;
031import java.util.concurrent.*;
032import java.util.function.*;
033
034import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
036import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
037import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
038import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
039import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
040import org.apache.juneau.swap.*;
041
042/**
043 * A wrapper class around the {@link Class} object that provides cached information about that class.
044 *
045 * <p>
046 * Instances of this class can be created through the {@link BeanContext#getClassMeta(Class)} method.
047 *
048 * <p>
049 * The {@link BeanContext} class will cache and reuse instances of this class except for the following class types:
050 * <ul>
051 *    <li>Arrays
052 *    <li>Maps with non-Object key/values.
053 *    <li>Collections with non-Object key/values.
054 * </ul>
055 *
056 * <p>
057 * This class is tied to the {@link BeanContext} class because it's that class that makes the determination of what is
058 * a bean.
059 *
060 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
061
062 * </ul>
063 *
064 * @param <T> The class type of the wrapped class.
065 */
066@Bean(properties="innerClass,classCategory,elementType,keyType,valueType,notABeanReason,initException,beanMeta")
067public final class ClassMeta<T> implements Type {
068
069   /** Class categories. */
070   enum ClassCategory {
071      MAP, COLLECTION, CLASS, METHOD, NUMBER, DECIMAL, BOOLEAN, CHAR, DATE, ARRAY, ENUM, OTHER, CHARSEQ, STR, OBJ, URI, BEANMAP, READER, INPUTSTREAM, VOID, ARGS, OPTIONAL
072   }
073
074   final Class<T> innerClass;                              // The class being wrapped.
075   final ClassInfo info;
076
077   private final Class<? extends T> implClass;             // The implementation class to use if this is an interface.
078   private final ClassCategory cc;                         // The class category.
079   private final Method fromStringMethod;                  // The static valueOf(String) or fromString(String) or forString(String) method (if it has one).
080   private final ConstructorInfo
081      noArgConstructor,                                    // The no-arg constructor for this class (if it has one).
082      stringConstructor;                                   // The X(String) constructor (if it has one).
083   private final Method
084      exampleMethod;                                       // The example() or @Example-annotated method (if it has one).
085   private final Field
086      exampleField;                                        // The @Example-annotated field (if it has one).
087   private final Setter
088      namePropertyMethod,                                  // The method to set the name on an object (if it has one).
089      parentPropertyMethod;                                // The method to set the parent on an object (if it has one).
090   private final boolean
091      isDelegate,                                          // True if this class extends Delegate.
092      isAbstract,                                          // True if this class is abstract.
093      isMemberClass;                                       // True if this is a non-static member class.
094   private final Object primitiveDefault;                  // Default value for primitive type classes.
095   private final Map<String,Method>
096      publicMethods;                                       // All public methods, including static methods.
097   private final ObjectSwap<?,?>[] childSwaps;              // Any ObjectSwaps where the normal type is a subclass of this class.
098   private final ConcurrentHashMap<Class<?>,ObjectSwap<?,?>>
099      childSwapMap,                                        // Maps normal subclasses to ObjectSwaps.
100      childUnswapMap;                                      // Maps swap subclasses to ObjectSwaps.
101   private final ObjectSwap<T,?>[] swaps;                     // The object POJO swaps associated with this bean (if it has any).
102   private final BuilderSwap<T,?> builderSwap;             // The builder swap associated with this bean (if it has one).
103   private final BeanContext beanContext;                  // The bean context that created this object.
104   private final ClassMeta<?>
105      elementType,                                         // If ARRAY or COLLECTION, the element class type.
106      keyType,                                             // If MAP, the key class type.
107      valueType;                                           // If MAP, the value class type.
108   private final BeanMeta<T> beanMeta;                     // The bean meta for this bean class (if it's a bean).
109   private final String
110      typePropertyName,                                    // The property name of the _type property for this class and subclasses.
111      notABeanReason,                                      // If this isn't a bean, the reason why.
112      dictionaryName;                                      // The dictionary name of this class if it has one.
113   private final Throwable initException;                  // Any exceptions thrown in the init() method.
114   private final InvocationHandler invocationHandler;      // The invocation handler for this class (if it has one).
115   private final BeanRegistry beanRegistry;                // The bean registry of this class meta (if it has one).
116   private final ClassMeta<?>[] args;                      // Arg types if this is an array of args.
117   private final String example;                           // Example JSON.
118   private final Map<Class<?>,Mutater<?,T>> fromMutaters = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
119   private final Map<Class<?>,Mutater<T,?>> toMutaters = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
120   private final Mutater<String,T> stringMutater;
121   private final Map<Class<?>,Annotation[]> annotationArrayMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
122   private final Map<Class<?>,Optional<?>> annotationLastMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
123   private final Map<String,Optional<?>> properties = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
124   private final BiMap<Object,String> enumValues;
125
126   private final SimpleReadWriteLock lock = new SimpleReadWriteLock(false);
127
128   /**
129    * Construct a new {@code ClassMeta} based on the specified {@link Class}.
130    *
131    * @param innerClass The class being wrapped.
132    * @param beanContext The bean context that created this object.
133    * @param implClass
134    *    For interfaces and abstract classes, this represents the "real" class to instantiate.
135    *    Can be <jk>null</jk>.
136    * @param swaps
137    *    The {@link ObjectSwap} programmatically associated with this class.
138    *    Can be <jk>null</jk>.
139    * @param childSwaps
140    *    The child {@link ObjectSwap ObjectSwaps} programmatically associated with this class.
141    *    These are the <c>ObjectSwaps</c> that have normal classes that are subclasses of this class.
142    *    Can be <jk>null</jk>.
143    * @param delayedInit
144    *    Don't call init() in constructor.
145    *    Used for delayed initialization when the possibility of class reference loops exist.
146    */
147   @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
148   ClassMeta(Class<T> innerClass, BeanContext beanContext, ObjectSwap<T,?>[] swaps, ObjectSwap<?,?>[] childSwaps) {
149      this.innerClass = innerClass;
150      this.info = ClassInfo.of(innerClass);
151      this.beanContext = beanContext;
152      String notABeanReason = null;
153
154      try (SimpleLock x = lock.write()) {
155         // We always immediately add this class meta to the bean context cache so that we can resolve recursive references.
156         if (beanContext != null && beanContext.cmCache != null && isCacheable(innerClass))
157            beanContext.cmCache.put(innerClass, this);
158
159         ClassMetaBuilder<T> builder = new ClassMetaBuilder(innerClass, beanContext, swaps, childSwaps);
160
161         this.cc = builder.cc;
162         this.isDelegate = builder.isDelegate;
163         this.fromStringMethod = builder.fromStringMethod;
164         this.parentPropertyMethod = builder.parentPropertyMethod;
165         this.namePropertyMethod = builder.namePropertyMethod;
166         this.noArgConstructor = builder.noArgConstructor;
167         this.stringConstructor = builder.stringConstructor;
168         this.primitiveDefault = builder.primitiveDefault;
169         this.publicMethods = builder.publicMethods;
170         this.swaps = builder.swaps.isEmpty() ? null : builder.swaps.toArray(new ObjectSwap[builder.swaps.size()]);
171         this.builderSwap = builder.builderSwap;
172         this.keyType = builder.keyType;
173         this.valueType = builder.valueType;
174         this.elementType = builder.elementType;
175         notABeanReason = builder.notABeanReason;
176         this.beanMeta = builder.beanMeta;
177         this.initException = builder.initException;
178         this.typePropertyName = builder.typePropertyName;
179         this.dictionaryName = builder.dictionaryName;
180         this.invocationHandler = builder.invocationHandler;
181         this.beanRegistry = builder.beanRegistry;
182         this.isMemberClass = builder.isMemberClass;
183         this.isAbstract = builder.isAbstract;
184         this.implClass = builder.implClass;
185         this.childUnswapMap = builder.childUnswapMap;
186         this.childSwapMap = builder.childSwapMap;
187         this.childSwaps = builder.childSwaps;
188         this.exampleMethod = builder.exampleMethod;
189         this.exampleField = builder.exampleField;
190         this.example = builder.example;
191         this.args = null;
192         this.stringMutater = builder.stringMutater;
193         this.enumValues = builder.enumValues == null ? null : builder.enumValues.build();
194      } catch (ClassMetaRuntimeException e) {
195         notABeanReason = e.getMessage();
196         throw e;
197      } finally {
198         this.notABeanReason = notABeanReason;
199      }
200   }
201
202   /**
203    * Generated classes shouldn't be cacheable to prevent needlessly filling up the cache.
204    */
205   private static boolean isCacheable(Class<?> c) {
206      String n = c.getName();
207      char x = n.charAt(n.length()-1);  // All generated classes appear to end with digits.
208      if (x >= '0' && x <= '9') {
209         if (n.indexOf("$$") != -1 || n.startsWith("sun") || n.startsWith("com.sun") || n.indexOf("$Proxy") != -1)
210            return false;
211      }
212      return true;
213   }
214
215   /**
216    * Causes thread to wait until constructor has exited.
217    */
218   void waitForInit() {
219      try (SimpleLock x = lock.read()) {}
220   }
221
222   /**
223    * Copy constructor.
224    *
225    * <p>
226    * Used for creating Map and Collection class metas that shouldn't be cached.
227    */
228   ClassMeta(ClassMeta<T> mainType, ClassMeta<?> keyType, ClassMeta<?> valueType, ClassMeta<?> elementType) {
229      this.innerClass = mainType.innerClass;
230      this.info = mainType.info;
231      this.implClass = mainType.implClass;
232      this.childSwaps = mainType.childSwaps;
233      this.childSwapMap = mainType.childSwapMap;
234      this.childUnswapMap = mainType.childUnswapMap;
235      this.cc = mainType.cc;
236      this.fromStringMethod = mainType.fromStringMethod;
237      this.noArgConstructor = mainType.noArgConstructor;
238      this.stringConstructor = mainType.stringConstructor;
239      this.namePropertyMethod = mainType.namePropertyMethod;
240      this.parentPropertyMethod = mainType.parentPropertyMethod;
241      this.isDelegate = mainType.isDelegate;
242      this.isAbstract = mainType.isAbstract;
243      this.isMemberClass = mainType.isMemberClass;
244      this.primitiveDefault = mainType.primitiveDefault;
245      this.publicMethods = mainType.publicMethods;
246      this.beanContext = mainType.beanContext;
247      this.elementType = elementType;
248      this.keyType = keyType;
249      this.valueType = valueType;
250      this.invocationHandler = mainType.invocationHandler;
251      this.beanMeta = mainType.beanMeta;
252      this.typePropertyName = mainType.typePropertyName;
253      this.dictionaryName = mainType.dictionaryName;
254      this.notABeanReason = mainType.notABeanReason;
255      this.swaps = mainType.swaps;
256      this.builderSwap = mainType.builderSwap;
257      this.initException = mainType.initException;
258      this.beanRegistry = mainType.beanRegistry;
259      this.exampleMethod = mainType.exampleMethod;
260      this.exampleField = mainType.exampleField;
261      this.example = mainType.example;
262      this.args = null;
263      this.stringMutater = mainType.stringMutater;
264      this.enumValues = mainType.enumValues;
265   }
266
267   /**
268    * Constructor for args-arrays.
269    */
270   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
271   ClassMeta(ClassMeta<?>[] args) {
272      this.innerClass = (Class<T>) Object[].class;
273      this.info = ClassInfo.of(innerClass);
274      this.args = args;
275      this.implClass = null;
276      this.childSwaps = null;
277      this.childSwapMap = null;
278      this.childUnswapMap = null;
279      this.cc = ARGS;
280      this.fromStringMethod = null;
281      this.noArgConstructor = null;
282      this.stringConstructor = null;
283      this.namePropertyMethod = null;
284      this.parentPropertyMethod = null;
285      this.isDelegate = false;
286      this.isAbstract = false;
287      this.isMemberClass = false;
288      this.primitiveDefault = null;
289      this.publicMethods = null;
290      this.beanContext = null;
291      this.elementType = null;
292      this.keyType = null;
293      this.valueType = null;
294      this.invocationHandler = null;
295      this.beanMeta = null;
296      this.typePropertyName = null;
297      this.dictionaryName = null;
298      this.notABeanReason = null;
299      this.swaps = null;
300      this.builderSwap = null;
301      this.initException = null;
302      this.beanRegistry = null;
303      this.exampleMethod = null;
304      this.exampleField = null;
305      this.example = null;
306      this.stringMutater = null;
307      this.enumValues = null;
308   }
309
310   @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes","hiding"})
311   private final class ClassMetaBuilder<T> {
312      Class<T> innerClass;
313      ClassInfo ci;
314      Class<? extends T> implClass;
315      BeanContext beanContext;
316      ClassCategory cc = ClassCategory.OTHER;
317      boolean
318         isDelegate = false,
319         isMemberClass = false,
320         isAbstract = false;
321      Method
322         fromStringMethod = null;
323      Setter
324         parentPropertyMethod = null,
325         namePropertyMethod = null;
326      ConstructorInfo
327         noArgConstructor = null,
328         stringConstructor = null;
329      Object primitiveDefault = null;
330      Map<String,Method>
331         publicMethods = map();
332      ClassMeta<?>
333         keyType = null,
334         valueType = null,
335         elementType = null;
336      String
337         typePropertyName = null,
338         notABeanReason = null,
339         dictionaryName = null;
340      Throwable initException = null;
341      BeanMeta beanMeta = null;
342      List<ObjectSwap> swaps = list();
343      BuilderSwap builderSwap;
344      InvocationHandler invocationHandler = null;
345      BeanRegistry beanRegistry = null;
346      ObjectSwap<?,?>[] childSwaps;
347      ConcurrentHashMap<Class<?>,ObjectSwap<?,?>>
348         childSwapMap,
349         childUnswapMap;
350      Method exampleMethod;
351      Field exampleField;
352      String example;
353      Mutater<String,T> stringMutater;
354      BiMap.Builder<Object,String> enumValues;
355
356      ClassMetaBuilder(Class<T> innerClass, BeanContext beanContext, ObjectSwap<T,?>[] swaps, ObjectSwap<?,?>[] childSwaps) {
357         this.innerClass = innerClass;
358         this.beanContext = beanContext;
359         BeanContext bc = beanContext;
360
361         this.childSwaps = childSwaps;
362         if (childSwaps == null) {
363            this.childSwapMap = null;
364            this.childUnswapMap = null;
365         } else {
366            this.childSwapMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
367            this.childUnswapMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
368         }
369
370         Class<T> c = innerClass;
371         ci = ClassInfo.of(c);
372
373         if (c.isPrimitive()) {
374            if (c == Boolean.TYPE)
375               cc = BOOLEAN;
376            else if (c == Byte.TYPE || c == Short.TYPE || c == Integer.TYPE || c == Long.TYPE || c == Float.TYPE || c == Double.TYPE) {
377               if (c == Float.TYPE || c == Double.TYPE)
378                  cc = DECIMAL;
379               else
380                  cc = NUMBER;
381            }
382            else if (c == Character.TYPE)
383               cc = CHAR;
384            else if (c == void.class || c == Void.class)
385               cc = VOID;
386         } else {
387            if (ci.isChildOf(Delegate.class))
388               isDelegate = true;
389
390            if (c == Object.class)
391               cc = OBJ;
392            else if (c.isEnum())
393               cc = ENUM;
394            else if (c.equals(Class.class))
395               cc = ClassCategory.CLASS;
396            else if (ci.isChildOf(Method.class))
397               cc = METHOD;
398            else if (ci.isChildOf(CharSequence.class)) {
399               if (c.equals(String.class))
400                  cc = STR;
401               else
402                  cc = CHARSEQ;
403            }
404            else if (ci.isChildOf(Number.class)) {
405               if (ci.isChildOfAny(Float.class, Double.class))
406                  cc = DECIMAL;
407               else
408                  cc = NUMBER;
409            }
410            else if (ci.isChildOf(Collection.class))
411               cc = COLLECTION;
412            else if (ci.isChildOf(Map.class)) {
413               if (ci.isChildOf(BeanMap.class))
414                  cc = BEANMAP;
415               else
416                  cc = MAP;
417            }
418            else if (c == Character.class)
419               cc = CHAR;
420            else if (c == Boolean.class)
421               cc = BOOLEAN;
422            else if (ci.isChildOfAny(Date.class, Calendar.class))
423               cc = DATE;
424            else if (c.isArray())
425               cc = ARRAY;
426            else if (ci.isChildOfAny(URL.class, URI.class) || ci.hasAnnotation(bc, Uri.class))
427               cc = URI;
428            else if (ci.isChildOf(Reader.class))
429               cc = READER;
430            else if (ci.isChildOf(InputStream.class))
431               cc = INPUTSTREAM;
432            else if (ci.is(Optional.class))
433               cc = OPTIONAL;
434         }
435
436         isMemberClass = ci.isMemberClass() && ci.isNotStatic();
437
438         // Find static fromString(String) or equivalent method.
439         // fromString() must be checked before valueOf() so that Enum classes can create their own
440         //    specialized fromString() methods to override the behavior of Enum.valueOf(String).
441         // valueOf() is used by enums.
442         // parse() is used by the java logging Level class.
443         // forName() is used by Class and Charset
444         String[] fromStringMethodNames = {"fromString","fromValue","valueOf","parse","parseString","forName","forString"};
445         fromStringMethod = Utils.opt(ci.getPublicMethod(
446         x -> x.isStatic()
447         && x.isNotDeprecated()
448         && x.hasReturnType(c)
449         && x.hasParamTypes(String.class)
450         && ArrayUtils.contains(x.getName(), fromStringMethodNames))).map(MethodInfo::inner)
451            .orElse(null);
452
453         // Find example() method if present.
454         exampleMethod = Utils.opt(ci.getPublicMethod(
455         x -> x.isStatic()
456         && x.isNotDeprecated()
457         && x.hasName("example")
458         && x.hasFuzzyParamTypes(BeanSession.class))).map(MethodInfo::inner)
459            .orElse(null);
460
461         ci.forEachAllField(x -> x.hasAnnotation(bc, ParentProperty.class), x -> {
462            if (x.isStatic())
463               throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "@ParentProperty used on invalid field ''{0}''.  Must be static.", x);
464            parentPropertyMethod = new Setter.FieldSetter(x.accessible().inner());
465         });
466
467         ci.forEachAllField(x -> x.hasAnnotation(bc, NameProperty.class), x -> {
468            if (x.isStatic())
469               throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "@NameProperty used on invalid field ''{0}''.  Must be static.", x);
470            namePropertyMethod = new Setter.FieldSetter(x.accessible().inner());
471         });
472
473         ci.forEachDeclaredField(x -> x.hasAnnotation(bc, Example.class), x -> {
474            if (! (x.isStatic() && ci.isParentOf(x.getType().inner())))
475               throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "@Example used on invalid field ''{0}''.  Must be static and an instance of the type.", x);
476            exampleField = x.accessible().inner();
477         });
478
479         // Find @NameProperty and @ParentProperty methods if present.
480         List<MethodInfo> methods = ci.getMethods();
481         for (int i = methods.size()-1; i >=0; i--) {
482            MethodInfo m = methods.get(i);
483            if (m.hasAnnotation(bc, ParentProperty.class)) {
484               if (m.isStatic() || ! m.hasNumParams(1))
485                  throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "@ParentProperty used on invalid method ''{0}''.  Must not be static and have one argument.", m);
486               m.setAccessible();
487               parentPropertyMethod = new Setter.MethodSetter(m.inner());
488            }
489            if (m.hasAnnotation(bc, NameProperty.class)) {
490               if (m.isStatic() || ! m.hasNumParams(1))
491                  throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "@NameProperty used on invalid method ''{0}''.  Must not be static and have one argument.", m);
492               m.setAccessible();
493               namePropertyMethod = new Setter.MethodSetter(m.inner());
494            }
495         }
496
497         ci.forEachDeclaredMethod(m -> m.hasAnnotation(bc, Example.class), m -> {
498            if (! (m.isStatic() && m.hasFuzzyParamTypes(BeanSession.class) && ci.isParentOf(m.getReturnType().inner())))
499               throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "@Example used on invalid method ''{0}''.  Must be static and return an instance of the declaring class.", m.toString());
500            m.setAccessible();
501            exampleMethod = m.inner();
502         });
503
504         // Note:  Primitive types are normally abstract.
505         isAbstract = ci.isAbstract() && ci.isNotPrimitive();
506
507         // Find constructor(String) method if present.
508         ci.forEachPublicConstructor(cs -> cs.isPublic() && cs.isNotDeprecated(), cs -> {
509            List<ClassInfo> pt = cs.getParamTypes();
510            if (pt.size() == (isMemberClass ? 1 : 0) && c != Object.class && ! isAbstract) {
511               noArgConstructor = cs;
512            } else if (pt.size() == (isMemberClass ? 2 : 1)) {
513               ClassInfo arg = pt.get(isMemberClass ? 1 : 0);
514               if (arg.is(String.class))
515                  stringConstructor = cs;
516            }
517         });
518
519         primitiveDefault = ci.getPrimitiveDefault();
520
521         ci.forEachPublicMethod(
522            MethodInfo::isNotDeprecated,
523            x -> publicMethods.put(x.getSignature(), x.inner())
524         );
525
526         BeanFilter beanFilter = findBeanFilter(bc);
527         MarshalledFilter marshalledFilter = findMarshalledFilter(bc);
528
529         addAll(this.swaps, swaps);
530
531         if (bc != null)
532            this.builderSwap = BuilderSwap.findSwapFromObjectClass(bc, c, bc.getBeanConstructorVisibility(), bc.getBeanMethodVisibility());
533
534         findSwaps(this.swaps, bc);
535
536         if (beanFilter != null) {
537            example = beanFilter.getExample();
538            implClass = (Class<? extends T>) beanFilter.getImplClass();
539         }
540
541         if (marshalledFilter != null) {
542            if (example == null)
543               example = marshalledFilter.getExample();
544            if (implClass == null)
545               implClass = (Class<? extends T>) marshalledFilter.getImplClass();
546         }
547
548         if (innerClass != Object.class) {
549            ClassInfo x = implClass == null ? ci : ClassInfo.of(implClass);
550            noArgConstructor = x.getPublicConstructor(ConstructorInfo::hasNoParams);
551         }
552
553         try {
554
555            // If this is an array, get the element type.
556            if (cc == ARRAY)
557               elementType = findClassMeta(innerClass.getComponentType());
558
559            // If this is a MAP, see if it's parameterized (e.g. AddressBook extends HashMap<String,Person>)
560            else if (cc == MAP) {
561               ClassMeta[] parameters = findParameters();
562               if (parameters != null && parameters.length == 2) {
563                  keyType = parameters[0];
564                  valueType = parameters[1];
565               } else {
566                  keyType = findClassMeta(Object.class);
567                  valueType = findClassMeta(Object.class);
568               }
569            }
570
571            // If this is a COLLECTION, see if it's parameterized (e.g. AddressBook extends LinkedList<Person>)
572            else if (cc == COLLECTION || cc == OPTIONAL) {
573               ClassMeta[] parameters = findParameters();
574               if (parameters != null && parameters.length == 1) {
575                  elementType = parameters[0];
576               } else {
577                  elementType = findClassMeta(Object.class);
578               }
579            }
580
581            // If the category is unknown, see if it's a bean.
582            // Note that this needs to be done after all other initialization has been done.
583            else if (cc == OTHER) {
584
585               BeanMeta newMeta = null;
586               try {
587                  newMeta = new BeanMeta(ClassMeta.this, bc, beanFilter, null, implClass == null ? null : noArgConstructor);
588                  notABeanReason = newMeta.notABeanReason;
589
590                  // Always get these even if it's not a bean:
591                  beanRegistry = newMeta.beanRegistry;
592                  typePropertyName = newMeta.typePropertyName;
593
594               } catch (RuntimeException e) {
595                  notABeanReason = e.getMessage();
596                  throw e;
597               }
598               if (notABeanReason == null)
599                  beanMeta = newMeta;
600            }
601
602         } catch (NoClassDefFoundError e) {
603            initException = e;
604         } catch (RuntimeException e) {
605            initException = e;
606            throw e;
607         }
608
609         if (beanMeta != null)
610            dictionaryName = beanMeta.getDictionaryName();
611
612         if (beanMeta != null && bc != null && bc.isUseInterfaceProxies() && innerClass.isInterface())
613            invocationHandler = new BeanProxyInvocationHandler<T>(beanMeta);
614
615         if (bc != null) {
616            bc.forEachAnnotation(Bean.class, c, x -> true, x -> {
617               if (x.dictionary().length != 0)
618                  beanRegistry = new BeanRegistry(bc, null, x.dictionary());
619               // This could be a non-bean POJO with a type name.
620               if (dictionaryName == null && ! x.typeName().isEmpty())
621                  dictionaryName = x.typeName();
622            });
623         }
624
625         if (example == null && bc != null) {
626            bc.forEachAnnotation(Example.class, c, x -> ! x.value().isEmpty(), x -> example = x.value());
627         }
628
629         if (example == null) {
630            switch(cc) {
631               case BOOLEAN:
632                  example = "true";
633                  break;
634               case CHAR:
635                  example = "a";
636                  break;
637               case CHARSEQ:
638               case STR:
639                  example = "foo";
640                  break;
641               case DECIMAL:
642                  if (isFloat())
643                     example = "1.0";
644                  else if (isDouble())
645                     example = "1.0";
646                  break;
647               case ENUM:
648                  Iterator<? extends Enum> i = EnumSet.allOf((Class<? extends Enum>)c).iterator();
649                  if (i.hasNext())
650                     example = beanContext.isUseEnumNames() ? i.next().name() : i.next().toString();
651                  break;
652               case NUMBER:
653                  if (isShort())
654                     example = "1";
655                  else if (isInteger())
656                     example = "1";
657                  else if (isLong())
658                     example = "1";
659                  break;
660               case URI:
661               case ARGS:
662               case ARRAY:
663               case BEANMAP:
664               case CLASS:
665               case COLLECTION:
666               case DATE:
667               case INPUTSTREAM:
668               case MAP:
669               case METHOD:
670               case OBJ:
671               case OTHER:
672               case READER:
673               case OPTIONAL:
674               case VOID:
675                  break;
676            }
677         }
678
679         this.stringMutater = Mutaters.get(String.class, c);
680
681         if (cc == ENUM) {
682            Class<? extends Enum> ec = (Class<? extends Enum<?>>)c;
683            boolean useEnumNames = bc != null && bc.isUseEnumNames();
684            enumValues = BiMap.create();
685            enumValues.unmodifiable();
686            stream(ec.getEnumConstants()).forEach(x -> enumValues.add(x, useEnumNames ? x.name() : x.toString()));
687         }
688      }
689
690      private BeanFilter findBeanFilter(BeanContext bc) {
691         try {
692            List<Bean> ba = info.getAnnotations(bc, Bean.class);
693            if (! ba.isEmpty())
694               return BeanFilter.create(innerClass).applyAnnotations(ba).build();
695         } catch (Exception e) {
696            throw asRuntimeException(e);
697         }
698         return null;
699      }
700
701      private MarshalledFilter findMarshalledFilter(BeanContext bc) {
702         try {
703            List<Marshalled> ba = info.getAnnotations(bc, Marshalled.class);
704            if (! ba.isEmpty())
705               return MarshalledFilter.create(innerClass).applyAnnotations(ba).build();
706         } catch (Exception e) {
707            throw asRuntimeException(e);
708         }
709         return null;
710      }
711
712      private void findSwaps(List<ObjectSwap> l, BeanContext bc) {
713
714         if (bc != null)
715            bc.forEachAnnotation(Swap.class, innerClass, x -> true, x -> l.add(createSwap(x)));
716
717         ObjectSwap defaultSwap = DefaultSwaps.find(ci);
718         if (defaultSwap == null)
719            defaultSwap = AutoObjectSwap.find(bc, ci);
720         if (defaultSwap == null)
721            defaultSwap = AutoNumberSwap.find(bc, ci);
722         if (defaultSwap == null)
723            defaultSwap = AutoMapSwap.find(bc, ci);
724         if (defaultSwap == null)
725            defaultSwap = AutoListSwap.find(bc, ci);
726         if (defaultSwap != null)
727            l.add(defaultSwap);
728      }
729
730      private ObjectSwap<T,?> createSwap(Swap s) {
731         Class<?> c = s.value();
732         if (ClassUtils.isVoid(c))
733            c = s.impl();
734         ClassInfo ci = ClassInfo.of(c);
735
736         if (ci.isChildOf(ObjectSwap.class)) {
737            ObjectSwap ps = BeanCreator.of(ObjectSwap.class).type(c).run();
738            if (s.mediaTypes().length > 0)
739               ps.forMediaTypes(MediaType.ofAll(s.mediaTypes()));
740            if (! s.template().isEmpty())
741               ps.withTemplate(s.template());
742            return ps;
743         }
744
745         if (ci.isChildOf(Surrogate.class)) {
746            List<SurrogateSwap<?,?>> l = SurrogateSwap.findObjectSwaps(c, beanContext);
747            if (! l.isEmpty())
748               return (ObjectSwap<T,?>)l.iterator().next();
749         }
750
751         throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "Invalid swap class ''{0}'' specified.  Must extend from ObjectSwap or Surrogate.", c);
752      }
753
754      private ClassMeta<?> findClassMeta(Class<?> c) {
755         return beanContext.getClassMeta(c, false);
756      }
757
758      private ClassMeta<?>[] findParameters() {
759         return beanContext.findParameters(innerClass, innerClass);
760      }
761   }
762

764    * Returns the {@link ClassInfo} wrapper for the underlying class.
765    *
766    * @return The {@link ClassInfo} wrapper for the underlying class, never <jk>null</jk>.
767    */
768   public ClassInfo getInfo() {
769      return info;
770   }

779    *    The type property name associated with this bean class, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no explicit type
780    *    property name defined or this isn't a bean.

782   public String getBeanTypePropertyName() {
783      return typePropertyName;

791    *

793    *    The type name associated with this bean class, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no type name defined or this
794    *    isn't a bean.
795    */
796   public String getDictionaryName() {
797      return dictionaryName;
798   }

802    *
803    * <p>
804    * This bean registry contains names specified in the {@link Bean#dictionary() @Bean(dictionary)} annotation
805    * defined on the class, regardless of whether the class is an actual bean.
806    * This allows interfaces to define subclasses with type names.
807    *
808    * @return The bean registry for this class, or <jk>null</jk> if no bean registry is associated with it.
809    */
810   public BeanRegistry getBeanRegistry() {
811      return beanRegistry;
812   }

820      return cc;

823   /**
824    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a superclass of or the same as the specified class.
825    *
826    * @param c The comparison class.
827    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a superclass of or the same as the specified class.
828    */
829   public boolean isAssignableFrom(Class<?> c) {
830      return info.isChildOf(c);
831   }
832
833   /**
834    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a subclass of or the same as the specified class.
835    *
836    * @param c The comparison class.
837    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a subclass of or the same as the specified class.
838    */
839   public boolean isInstanceOf(Class<?> c) {
840      return info.isParentOf(c);

843   /**
844    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class or any child classes has a {@link ObjectSwap} associated with it.
845    *
846    * <p>
847    * Used when transforming bean properties to prevent having to look up transforms if we know for certain that no
848    * transforms are associated with a bean property.
849    *
850    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class or any child classes has a {@link ObjectSwap} associated with it.
851    */
852   protected boolean hasChildSwaps() {
853      return childSwaps != null;
854   }
855
856   /**
857    * Returns the {@link ObjectSwap} where the specified class is the same/subclass of the normal class of one of the
858    * child POJO swaps associated with this class.
859    *
860    * @param normalClass The normal class being resolved.
861    * @return The resolved {@link ObjectSwap} or <jk>null</jk> if none were found.
862    */
863   protected ObjectSwap<?,?> getChildObjectSwapForSwap(Class<?> normalClass) {
864      if (childSwapMap != null) {
865         ObjectSwap<?,?> s = childSwapMap.get(normalClass);
866         if (s == null) {
867            for (ObjectSwap<?,?> f : childSwaps)
868               if (s == null && f.getNormalClass().isParentOf(normalClass))
869                  s = f;
870            if (s == null)
871               s = ObjectSwap.NULL;
872            ObjectSwap<?,?> s2 = childSwapMap.putIfAbsent(normalClass, s);
873            if (s2 != null)
874               s = s2;
875         }
876         if (s == ObjectSwap.NULL)
877            return null;
878         return s;
879      }
880      return null;
881   }
882
883   /**
884    * Returns the {@link ObjectSwap} where the specified class is the same/subclass of the swap class of one of the child
885    * POJO swaps associated with this class.
886    *
887    * @param swapClass The swap class being resolved.
888    * @return The resolved {@link ObjectSwap} or <jk>null</jk> if none were found.
889    */
890   protected ObjectSwap<?,?> getChildObjectSwapForUnswap(Class<?> swapClass) {
891      if (childUnswapMap != null) {
892         ObjectSwap<?,?> s = childUnswapMap.get(swapClass);
893         if (s == null) {
894            for (ObjectSwap<?,?> f : childSwaps)
895               if (s == null && f.getSwapClass().isParentOf(swapClass))
896                  s = f;
897            if (s == null)
898               s = ObjectSwap.NULL;
899            ObjectSwap<?,?> s2 = childUnswapMap.putIfAbsent(swapClass, s);
900            if (s2 != null)
901               s = s2;
902         }
903         if (s == ObjectSwap.NULL)
904            return null;
905         return s;
906      }
907      return null;
908   }
909
910   /**
911    * Locates the no-arg constructor for the specified class.
912    *
913    * <p>
914    * Constructor must match the visibility requirements specified by parameter 'v'.
915    * If class is abstract, always returns <jk>null</jk>.
916    * Note that this also returns the 1-arg constructor for non-static member classes.
917    *
918    * @param <T> The class from which to locate the no-arg constructor.
919    * @param c The class from which to locate the no-arg constructor.
920    * @param v The minimum visibility.
921    * @return The constructor, or <jk>null</jk> if no no-arg constructor exists with the required visibility.
922    */
923   @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked"})
924   protected static <T> Constructor<? extends T> findNoArgConstructor(Class<?> c, Visibility v) {
925      ClassInfo ci = ClassInfo.of(c);
926      if (ci.isAbstract())
927         return null;
928      boolean isMemberClass = ci.isMemberClass() && ci.isNotStatic();
929      ConstructorInfo cc = ci.getPublicConstructor(
930         x -> x.isVisible(v)
931         && x.isNotDeprecated()
932         && x.hasNumParams(isMemberClass ? 1 : 0)
933      );
934      if (cc != null)
935         return (Constructor<? extends T>) v.transform(cc.inner());
936      return null;
937   }
938
939   /**
940    * Returns the {@link Class} object that this class type wraps.
941    *
942    * @return The wrapped class object.
943    */
944   public Class<T> getInnerClass() {
945      return innerClass;
946   }
947
948   /**
949    * Returns the serialized (swapped) form of this class if there is an {@link ObjectSwap} associated with it.
950    *
951    * @param session
952    *    The bean session.
953    *    <br>Required because the swap used may depend on the media type being serialized or parsed.
954    * @return The serialized class type, or this object if no swap is associated with the class.
955    */
956   public ClassMeta<?> getSerializedClassMeta(BeanSession session) {
957      ObjectSwap<T,?> ps = getSwap(session);
958      return (ps == null ? this : ps.getSwapClassMeta(session));
959   }
960
961   /**
962    * Returns the example of this class.
963    *
964    * @param session
965    *    The bean session.
966    *    <br>Required because the example method may take it in as a parameter.
967    * @param jpSession The JSON parser for parsing examples into POJOs.
968    * @return The serialized class type, or this object if no swap is associated with the class.
969    */
970   @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes"})
971   public T getExample(BeanSession session, JsonParserSession jpSession) {
972      try {
973         if (example != null)
974            return jpSession.parse(example, this);
975         if (exampleMethod != null)
976            return (T)MethodInfo.of(exampleMethod).invokeFuzzy(null, session);
977         if (exampleField != null)
978            return (T)exampleField.get(null);
979
980         if (isCollection()) {
981            Object etExample = getElementType().getExample(session, jpSession);
982            if (etExample != null) {
983               if (canCreateNewInstance()) {
984                  Collection c = (Collection)newInstance();
985                  c.add(etExample);
986                  return (T)c;
987               }
988               return (T)Collections.singleton(etExample);
989            }
990         } else if (isArray()) {
991            Object etExample = getElementType().getExample(session, jpSession);
992            if (etExample != null) {
993               Object o = Array.newInstance(getElementType().innerClass, 1);
994               Array.set(o, 0, etExample);
995               return (T)o;
996            }
997         } else if (isMap()) {
998            Object vtExample = getValueType().getExample(session, jpSession);
999            Object ktExample = getKeyType().getExample(session, jpSession);
1000            if (ktExample != null && vtExample != null) {
1001               if (canCreateNewInstance()) {
1002                  Map m = (Map)newInstance();
1003                  m.put(ktExample, vtExample);
1004                  return (T)m;
1005               }
1006               return (T)Collections.singletonMap(ktExample, vtExample);
1007            }
1008         }
1009
1010         return null;
1011      } catch (Exception e) {
1012         throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(e);
1013      }
1014   }
1015

1017    * For array and {@code Collection} types, returns the class type of the components of the array or
1018    * {@code Collection}.
1019    *
1020    * @return The element class type, or <jk>null</jk> if this class is not an array or Collection.
1021    */
1022   public ClassMeta<?> getElementType() {
1023      return elementType;

1272   /**

1431      return args;

1433
1434   /**
1435    * Returns the argument metadata at the specified index if this is an args metadata object.
1436    *
1437    * @param index The argument index.
1438    * @return The The argument metadata.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1439    * @throws BeanRuntimeException If this metadata object is not a list of arguments, or the index is out of range.
1440    */
1441   public ClassMeta<?> getArg(int index) {
1442      if (args != null && index >= 0 && index < args.length)
1443         return args[index];
1444      throw new BeanRuntimeException("Invalid argument index specified:  {0}.  Only {1} arguments are defined.", index, args == null ? 0 : args.length);
1445   }

1447   /**
1448    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if instance of this object can be <jk>null</jk>.
1449    *
1450    * <p>
1451    * Objects can be <jk>null</jk>, but primitives cannot, except for chars which can be represented by
1452    * <code>(<jk>char</jk>)0</code>.
1453    *
1454    * @return <jk>true</jk> if instance of this class can be null.
1455    */
1456   public boolean isNullable() {
1457      if (innerClass.isPrimitive())
1458         return cc == CHAR;
1459      return true;
1460   }

1492   /**
1493    * Returns the {@link ObjectSwap} associated with this class that's the best match for the specified session.
1494    *
1495    * @param session
1496    *    The current bean session.
1497    *    <br>If multiple swaps are associated with a class, only the first one with a matching media type will
1498    *    be returned.
1499    * @return
1500    *    The {@link ObjectSwap} associated with this class, or <jk>null</jk> if there are no POJO swaps associated with
1501    *    this class.
1502    */
1503   public ObjectSwap<T,?> getSwap(BeanSession session) {
1504      if (swaps != null) {
1505         int matchQuant = 0, matchIndex = -1;
1506
1507         for (int i = 0; i < swaps.length; i++) {
1508            int q = swaps[i].match(session);
1509            if (q > matchQuant) {
1510               matchQuant = q;
1511               matchIndex = i;
1512            }
1513         }
1514
1515         if (matchIndex > -1)
1516            return swaps[matchIndex];
1517      }
1518      return null;
1519   }
1520
1521   /**
1522    * Returns the builder swap associated with this class.
1523    *
1524    * @param session The current bean session.
1525    * @return The builder swap associated with this class, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
1526    */
1527   public BuilderSwap<T,?> getBuilderSwap(BeanSession session) {
1528      return builderSwap;
1529   }

1572   /**
1573    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class has a no-arg constructor or invocation handler.
1574    *
1575    * @return <jk>true</jk> if a new instance of this class can be constructed.
1576    */
1577   public boolean canCreateNewInstance() {
1578      if (isMemberClass)
1579         return false;
1580      if (noArgConstructor != null || getProxyInvocationHandler() != null || (isArray() && elementType.canCreateNewInstance()))
1581         return true;
1582      return false;
1583   }
1584
1585   /**
1586    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class has a no-arg constructor or invocation handler.
1587    * Returns <jk>false</jk> if this is a non-static member class and the outer object does not match the class type of
1588    * the defining class.
1589    *
1590    * @param outer
1591    *    The outer class object for non-static member classes.  Can be <jk>null</jk> for non-member or static classes.
1592    * @return
1593    *    <jk>true</jk> if a new instance of this class can be created within the context of the specified outer object.
1594    */
1595   public boolean canCreateNewInstance(Object outer) {
1596      if (isMemberClass)
1597         return outer != null && noArgConstructor != null && noArgConstructor.hasParamTypes(outer.getClass());
1598      return canCreateNewInstance();
1599   }
1600
1601   /**
1602    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class can be instantiated as a bean.
1603    * Returns <jk>false</jk> if this is a non-static member class and the outer object does not match the class type of
1604    * the defining class.
1605    *
1606    * @param outer
1607    *    The outer class object for non-static member classes.  Can be <jk>null</jk> for non-member or static classes.
1608    * @return
1609    *    <jk>true</jk> if a new instance of this bean can be created within the context of the specified outer object.
1610    */
1611   public boolean canCreateNewBean(Object outer) {
1612      if (beanMeta == null || beanMeta.constructor == null)
1613         return false;
1614      if (isMemberClass)
1615         return outer != null && beanMeta.constructor.hasParamTypes(outer.getClass());
1616      return true;
1617   }
1618
1619   /**
1620    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class can call the {@link #newInstanceFromString(Object, String)} method.
1621    *
1622    * @param outer
1623    *    The outer class object for non-static member classes.
1624    *    Can be <jk>null</jk> for non-member or static classes.
1625    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class has a no-arg constructor or invocation handler.
1626    */
1627   public boolean canCreateNewInstanceFromString(Object outer) {
1628      if (fromStringMethod != null)
1629         return true;
1630      if (stringConstructor != null) {
1631         if (isMemberClass)
1632            return outer != null && stringConstructor.hasParamTypes(outer.getClass(), String.class);
1633         return true;
1634      }
1635      return false;
1636   }

1687   /**
1688    * Returns the default value for primitives such as <jk>int</jk> or <jk>Integer</jk>.
1689    *
1690    * @return The default value, or <jk>null</jk> if this class type is not a primitive.
1691    */
1692   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1693   public T getPrimitiveDefault() {
1694      return (T)primitiveDefault;
1695   }
1696
1697   /**
1698    * If this is an {@link Optional}, returns an empty optional.
1699    *
1700    * <p>
1701    * Note that if this is a nested optional, will recursively create empty optionals.
1702    *
1703    * @return An empty optional, or <jk>null</jk> if this isn't an optional.
1704    */
1705   public Optional<?> getOptionalDefault() {
1706      if (isOptional())
1707         return Utils.opt(getElementType().getOptionalDefault());
1708      return null;
1709   }
1710
1711   /**
1712    * Converts the specified object to a string.
1713    *
1714    * @param t The object to convert.
1715    * @return The object converted to a string, or <jk>null</jk> if the object was null.
1716    */
1717   public String toString(Object t) {
1718      if (t == null)
1719         return null;
1720      if (isEnum() && beanContext.isUseEnumNames())
1721         return ((Enum<?>)t).name();
1722      return t.toString();
1723   }
1724
1725   /**
1726    * Create a new instance of the main class of this declared type from a <c>String</c> input.
1727    *
1728    * <p>
1729    * In order to use this method, the class must have one of the following methods:
1730    * <ul>
1731    *    <li><code><jk>public static</jk> T valueOf(String in);</code>
1732    *    <li><code><jk>public static</jk> T fromString(String in);</code>
1733    *    <li><code><jk>public</jk> T(String in);</code>
1734    * </ul>
1735    *
1736    * @param outer
1737    *    The outer class object for non-static member classes.  Can be <jk>null</jk> for non-member or static classes.
1738    * @param arg The input argument value.
1739    * @return A new instance of the object, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no string constructor on the object.
1740    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
1741    */
1742   @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked" })
1743   public T newInstanceFromString(Object outer, String arg) throws ExecutableException {
1744
1745      if (isEnum()) {
1746         T t = (T)enumValues.getKey(arg);
1747         if (t == null && ! beanContext.isIgnoreUnknownEnumValues())
1748            throw new ExecutableException("Could not resolve enum value '"+arg+"' on class '"+getInnerClass().getName()+"'");
1749         return t;
1750      }
1751
1752      Method m = fromStringMethod;
1753      if (m != null) {
1754         try {
1755            return (T)m.invoke(null, arg);
1756         } catch (IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException | InvocationTargetException e) {
1757            throw new ExecutableException(e);
1758         }
1759      }
1760      ConstructorInfo c = stringConstructor;
1761      if (c != null) {
1762         if (isMemberClass)
1763            return c.<T>invoke(outer, arg);
1764         return c.<T>invoke(arg);
1765      }
1766      throw new ExecutableException("No string constructor or valueOf(String) method found for class '"+getInnerClass().getName()+"'");
1767   }
1768
1769   /**
1770    * Create a new instance of the main class of this declared type.
1771    *
1772    * @return A new instance of the object, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no no-arg constructor on the object.
1773    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
1774    */
1775   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1776   public T newInstance() throws ExecutableException {
1777      if (isArray())
1778         return (T)Array.newInstance(getInnerClass().getComponentType(), 0);
1779      ConstructorInfo c = getConstructor();
1780      if (c != null)
1781         return c.<T>invoke();
1782      InvocationHandler h = getProxyInvocationHandler();
1783      if (h != null)
1784         return (T)Proxy.newProxyInstance(this.getClass().getClassLoader(), new Class[] { getInnerClass(), java.io.Serializable.class }, h);
1785      if (isArray())
1786         return (T)Array.newInstance(this.elementType.innerClass,0);
1787      return null;
1788   }
1789
1790   /**
1791    * Same as {@link #newInstance()} except for instantiating non-static member classes.
1792    *
1793    * @param outer
1794    *    The instance of the owning object of the member class instance.
1795    *    Can be <jk>null</jk> if instantiating a non-member or static class.
1796    * @return A new instance of the object, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no no-arg constructor on the object.
1797    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
1798    */
1799   public T newInstance(Object outer) throws ExecutableException {
1800      if (isMemberClass)
1801         return noArgConstructor.<T>invoke(outer);
1802      return newInstance();
1803   }
1804
1805   /**
1806    * Similar to {@link #equals(Object)} except primitive and Object types that are similar are considered the same.
1807    * (e.g. <jk>boolean</jk> == <c>Boolean</c>).
1808    *
1809    * @param cm The class meta to compare to.
1810    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified class-meta is equivalent to this one.
1811    */
1812   public boolean same(ClassMeta<?> cm) {
1813      if (equals(cm))
1814         return true;
1815      return (isPrimitive() && cc == cm.cc);
1816   }
1817
1818   @Override /* Object */
1819   public String toString() {
1820      return toString(false);
1821   }
1822
1823   /**
1824    * Same as {@link #toString()} except use simple class names.
1825    *
1826    * @param simple Print simple class names only (no package).
1827    * @return A new string.
1828    */
1829   public String toString(boolean simple) {
1830      return toString(new StringBuilder(), simple).toString();
1831   }
1832
1833   /**
1834    * Appends this object as a readable string to the specified string builder.
1835    *
1836    * @param sb The string builder to append this object to.
1837    * @param simple Print simple class names only (no package).
1838    * @return The passed-in string builder.
1839    */
1840   protected StringBuilder toString(StringBuilder sb, boolean simple) {
1841      String n = innerClass.getName();
1842      if (simple) {
1843         int i = n.lastIndexOf('.');
1844         n = n.substring(i == -1 ? 0 : i+1).replace('$', '.');
1845      }
1846      if (cc == ARRAY)
1847         return elementType.toString(sb, simple).append('[').append(']');
1848      if (cc == MAP)
1849         return sb.append(n).append(keyType.isObject() && valueType.isObject() ? "" : "<"+keyType.toString(simple)+","+valueType.toString(simple)+">");
1850      if (cc == BEANMAP)
1851         return sb.append(BeanMap.class.getName()).append('<').append(n).append('>');
1852      if (cc == COLLECTION || cc == OPTIONAL)
1853         return sb.append(n).append(elementType.isObject() ? "" : "<"+elementType.toString(simple)+">");
1854      return sb.append(n);
1855   }
1856
1857   /**
1858    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is an instance of this class.
1859    *
1860    * <p>
1861    * This is a simple comparison on the base class itself and not on any generic parameters.
1862    *
1863    * @param o The object to check.
1864    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is an instance of this class.
1865    */
1866   public boolean isInstance(Object o) {
1867      if (o != null)
1868         return info.isParentOf(o.getClass()) || (isPrimitive() && info.getPrimitiveWrapper() == o.getClass());
1869      return false;
1870   }
1871
1872   /**
1873    * Returns a readable name for this class (e.g. <js>"java.lang.String"</js>, <js>"boolean[]"</js>).
1874    *
1875    * @return The readable name for this class.
1876    */
1877   public String getFullName() {
1878      return info.getFullName();
1879   }

1881   /**

1884    * @return The  name of the inner class.
1885    */
1886   public String getName() {
1887      return innerClass.getName();
1888   }

1890   /**

1892    *
1893    * @return The simple name of the inner class.
1894    */
1895   public String getSimpleName() {
1896      return innerClass.getSimpleName();
1897   }

1899   /**
1900    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class has a transform associated with it that allows it to be created from a Reader.
1901    *
1902    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class has a transform associated with it that allows it to be created from a Reader.
1903    */
1904   public boolean hasReaderMutater() {
1905      return hasMutaterFrom(Reader.class);
1906   }
1907
1908   /**
1909    * Returns the transform for this class for creating instances from a Reader.
1910    *
1911    * @return The transform, or <jk>null</jk> if no such transform exists.
1912    */
1913   public Mutater<Reader,T> getReaderMutater() {
1914      return getFromMutater(Reader.class);
1915   }
1916
1917   /**
1918    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class has a transform associated with it that allows it to be created from an InputStream.
1919    *
1920    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class has a transform associated with it that allows it to be created from an InputStream.
1921    */
1922   public boolean hasInputStreamMutater() {

2002      return (T)(t == null ? null : t.mutate(o));

2031   /**
2032    * Returns the transform for this class for creating instances from other object types.
2033    *
2034    * @param <I> The transform-from class.
2035    * @param c The transform-from class.
2036    * @return The transform, or <jk>null</jk> if no such transform exists.
2037    */
2038   @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
2039   public <I> Mutater<I,T> getFromMutater(Class<I> c) {
2040      Mutater t = fromMutaters.get(c);
2041      if (t == Mutaters.NULL)
2042         return null;
2043      if (t == null) {
2044         t = Mutaters.get(c, innerClass);
2045         if (t == null)
2046            t = Mutaters.NULL;
2047         fromMutaters.put(c, t);
2048      }
2049      return t == Mutaters.NULL ? null : t;
2050   }
2051
2052   /**
2053    * Returns the transform for this class for creating instances from other object types.
2054    *
2055    * @param <O> The transform-to class.
2056    * @param c The transform-from class.
2057    * @return The transform, or <jk>null</jk> if no such transform exists.
2058    */
2059   @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
2060   public <O> Mutater<T,O> getToMutater(Class<O> c) {
2061      Mutater t = toMutaters.get(c);
2062      if (t == Mutaters.NULL)
2063         return null;
2064      if (t == null) {
2065         t = Mutaters.get(innerClass, c);
2066         if (t == null)
2067            t = Mutaters.NULL;
2068         toMutaters.put(c, t);
2069      }
2070      return t == Mutaters.NULL ? null : t;
2071   }

2073   /**
2074    * Shortcut for calling <code>getInnerClass().getAnnotation(a) != <jk>null</jk></code>.
2075    *
2076    * @param a The annotation to check for.
2077    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the inner class has the annotation.
2078    */
2079   public boolean hasAnnotation(Class<? extends Annotation> a) {
2080      return getLastAnnotation(a) != null;
2081   }
2082
2083   /**
2084    * Shortcut for calling <c>getInnerClass().getAnnotation(a)</c>.
2085    *
2086    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
2087    * @param a The annotation to retrieve.
2088    * @return The specified annotation, or <jk>null</jk> if the class does not have the specified annotation.
2089    */
2090   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
2091   public <A extends Annotation> A getLastAnnotation(Class<A> a) {
2092      Optional<A> o = (Optional<A>)annotationLastMap.get(a);
2093      if (o == null) {
2094         if (beanContext == null)
2095            return info.getAnnotation(BeanContext.DEFAULT, a);
2096         o = Utils.opt(info.getAnnotation(beanContext, a));
2097         annotationLastMap.put(a, o);
2098      }
2099      return o.orElse(null);
2100   }
2101
2102   /**
2103    * Performs an action on all matching annotations of the specified type defined on this class or parent classes/interfaces in parent-to-child order.
2104    *
2105    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
2106    * @param type The annotation to search for.
2107    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
2108    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
2109    * @return This object.
2110    */
2111   public <A extends Annotation> ClassMeta<T> forEachAnnotation(Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter, Consumer<A> action) {
2112      A[] array = annotationArray(type);
2113      if (array == null) {
2114         if (beanContext == null)
2115            info.forEachAnnotation(BeanContext.DEFAULT, type, filter, action);
2116         return this;
2117      }
2118      for (A a : array)
2119         consume(filter, action, a);
2120      return this;
2121   }
2122
2123   /**
2124    * Returns the first matching annotation on this class or parent classes/interfaces in parent-to-child order.
2125    *
2126    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
2127    * @param type The annotation to search for.
2128    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if annotation should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
2129    * @return This object.
2130    */
2131   public <A extends Annotation> Optional<A> firstAnnotation(Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter) {
2132      A[] array = annotationArray(type);
2133      if (array == null) {
2134         if (beanContext == null)
2135            return Optional.ofNullable(info.firstAnnotation(BeanContext.DEFAULT, type, filter));
2136         return Optional.empty();
2137      }
2138      for (A a : array)
2139         if (test(filter, a))
2140            return Optional.of(a);
2141      return Optional.empty();
2142   }
2143
2144   /**
2145    * Returns the last matching annotation on this class or parent classes/interfaces in parent-to-child order.
2146    *
2147    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
2148    * @param type The annotation to search for.
2149    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if annotation should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
2150    * @return This object.
2151    */
2152   public <A extends Annotation> Optional<A> lastAnnotation(Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter) {
2153      A[] array = annotationArray(type);
2154      if (array == null) {
2155         if (beanContext == null)
2156            return Optional.ofNullable(info.lastAnnotation(BeanContext.DEFAULT, type, filter));
2157         return Optional.empty();
2158      }
2159      for (int i = array.length-1; i >= 0; i--)
2160         if (test(filter, array[i]))
2161            return Optional.of(array[i]);
2162      return Optional.empty();
2163   }
2164
2165   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
2166   private <A extends Annotation> A[] annotationArray(Class<A> type) {
2167      A[] array = (A[])annotationArrayMap.get(type);
2168      if (array == null && beanContext != null) {
2169         List<A> l = list();
2170         info.forEachAnnotation(beanContext, type, x-> true, x -> l.add(x));
2171         array = (A[])Array.newInstance(type, l.size());
2172         for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++)
2173            Array.set(array, i, l.get(i));
2174         annotationArrayMap.put(type, array);
2175      }
2176      return array;
2177   }
2178
2179   /**
2180    * Returns a calculated property on this context.
2181    *
2182    * @param <T2> The type to convert the property to.
2183    * @param name The name of the property.
2184    * @param function The function used to create this property.
2185    * @return The property value.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
2186    */
2187   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
2188   public <T2> Optional<T2> getProperty(String name, Function<ClassMeta<?>,T2> function) {
2189      Optional<T2> t = (Optional<T2>) properties.get(name);
2190      if (t == null) {
2191         t = Utils.opt(function.apply(this));
2192         properties.put(name, t);
2193      }
2194      return t;
2195   }

2212   @Override /* Object */
